summary: Build a QR-based attendance system for students/teachers with first-run registration, role selection, role-based dashboards, and a modern UI, delivered as an installable Android app with a downloadable APK.
architectural_notes: Target deliverable changed/clarified to an Android app with a downloadable APK (not just a PWA).
Add first-run detection to show registration before login for new users.
Persist user role (Student/Teacher) in user profile and route to role-specific dashboards after authentication.

existing_features.title: Add login/authentication for the app, including at least two roles: Admin (creates sessions and views all attendance) and Member/User (scans QR and views own check-ins).

Create the mobile-first frontend UI for the attendance system with a modern, professional visual theme that is consistent across all screens (colors, typography, spacing, components). Do not use a blue/purple primary palette.
Implement QR scanning in the frontend using the device camera (browser getUserMedia), and on successful scan, submit a check-in to the backend and show a clear success/failure result state.

Deliver the app as an Android-installable experience by implementing a Progressive Web App (PWA): web app manifest, service worker for basic offline shell caching, and install prompts/UX guidance for Android Chrome.

Add a clear delivery note in the project (e.g., a docs page within the app or a markdown file) explaining that this platform outputs a web/PWA build and providing step-by-step instructions to produce a downloadable Android APK externally by wrapping the PWA (e.g., Android Trusted Web Activity).

Add an app launch splash screen that is shown before the authentication/onboarding flow, and then automatically routes the user to the correct next screen (registration if first-time, otherwise login/dashboard).

Replace the current first-time profile setup dialog with a first-run Registration screen that collects (1) the userâ€™s name and (2) a role selection (Student or Teacher), and persists both to the user account.
Implement role-based navigation and dashboards so that after login, users are routed to the correct dashboard experience based on the saved role (Teacher vs Student).

Update role naming throughout the UI from Admin/User wording to Teacher/Student wording while keeping all user-facing text in English and ensuring the app remains consistent across login, registration, dashboard, and navigation.
Add a visible navigation entry to the existing Delivery Notes screen so users can easily find installation and APK-wrapping instructions from within the app.

Update the Delivery Notes UI content to more directly answer requests for a downloadable Android APK by clearly stating that the platform outputs a web/PWA build and providing copy-pasteable steps for producing an APK externally via TWA (Bubblewrap) and PWA Builder.

new_feature_requests.summary: Modern, professional mobile UI for Android
Provide a downloadable Android APK build for the app

Implement backend data models and APIs for a QR-based attendance system: users, sessions/events (each with a generated QR payload), and attendance records (who checked in, when, and for which session).
First-run onboarding flow: splash screen then registration screen on first app launch
Registration + role selection (Student/Teacher) persisted to user account and used on subsequent logins
Role-based dashboards: after login, open the appropriate dashboard based on saved role (Teacher vs Student)
